Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • Ship

  • class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
    It represents a Ship object to be implemented for Board class. It also contains all methods related to specific manipulation of Ships in a Board
    Version:
    ( 1.0 [24/12/15] )
    Author:
    (Mehul Ahal)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) boolean[] hits 
      (package private) boolean isSunk 
      (package private) java.awt.Point[] location 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ship(int n)
      Ship Constructor constructs a Ship Object with its location[] initialised to 'null' Points, hits[] to false and isSunk to false.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkMarkHit(Board playerBoard, java.awt.Point point, java.lang.String shipName)
      Method checkMarkHit returns a boolean value true if a given Point ('point') equals another Point on a given Ship's location[] indicating a 'hit' and marks the 'hit' on the Ship, or false otherwise.
      void tellSunk(Board board, java.lang.String shipName)
      Method tellSunk displays a message when a Ship is sunk (Ship.isSunk == true).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • checkMarkHit

        public boolean checkMarkHit(Board playerBoard,
                            java.awt.Point point,
                            java.lang.String shipName)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Method checkMarkHit returns a boolean value true if a given Point ('point') equals another Point on a given Ship's location[] indicating a 'hit' and marks the 'hit' on the Ship, or false otherwise.
